section.title: Indefinite Integrals & the Net Change Theorem

ul.li: Explain what is meant by an indefinite integral and use proper notation for definite/indefinite integrals
Use the Net Change Theorem to interpret definite integrals arising from real-world contexts, including finding distance traveled or displacement

definition.title: Indefinite Integral
definition.p: The indefinite integral is a family of functions F(x) such that F'(x) = f(x) or \ds \int f(x)\, dx = F(x)

example.statement: Write the indefinite integral for \ds \int x^2\, dx

question.statement: Give an explicit distinction between the definite integral and the indefinite integral.

solution.p: The definite integral always returns a number while the indefinite integral always returns a function.

In Section 4.3, we learned the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus. Rewrite FTC 2 here.

ol.label: a
ol.li: If f(x) is continuous on [a,b] and F(x) is an antiderivative of f(x) on that interval, then \ds \int_a^b f(x)\, dx = F(b) - F(a)

theorem.title: Net Change
theorem.p: The integral of a rate of change is the net change, i.e.: \ds \int_a^b F'(x)\, dx = F(b) - F(a)

question.statement: What relationship(s) do you see between the Net Change Theorem and FTC 2?

solution.p: We get the same result, but we are using different functions.

assemblage.title: Displacement/Distance
assemblage.p: When talking about physical situations, the displacement of a particle is the net change of the particle's position, and the distance is the total change of the particle's position.

example.statement:
A particle moves along a line so that its velocity at time t is v(t) = t^2-t-6 m/s.
Find the displacement of the particle during the time period 1\leq t\leq 4
Find the distance traveled during this time period.
A particle moving along a line has velocity v(t) = t^2 -2t-3 m/s. Find the displacement and the total distance traveled by the particle between 1 and 4 seconds.

solution.p: The displacement is -3 m and the distance traveled is \dfrac{23}{3} m

A honeybee population starts with 100 bees and increases at a rate of n'(t) bees per week. What does 100 + \ds \int_0^{15}n'(t)\,dt/ represent?

solution.p: It gives the total number of bees after 15 weeks.

example.statement: If x is measured in meters and f(x) is measured in newtons, what are the units of \ds \int_0^{100}f(x)\,dx?
The acceleration function of a particle is a(t) = t+4 m/s^2, and its the initial velocity is 5 m/s. Find the velocity at time t, and the distance traveled between time t = 0 and t = 5.

solution.p: The velocity is v(t) = \dfrac{1}{2}t^2 + 4t + 8 and the particle travels \dfrac{665}{6} m.

example.statement: Let r(\theta) = \dfrac{1+\cos^2\theta}{\cos^2\theta}. Find the indefinite integral \ds \int r(\theta)\, d\theta and the definite integral on the interval [0,\pi/4].

solution.p: \ds \int r(\theta)\, d\theta = \tan \theta + \theta + C and \ds \int_0^{\pi/4} r(\theta)\, d\theta = 1 + \dfrac{\pi}{4}

example.statement: If f(x) is the slope of a trail at a distance of x miles from the start of the trail, what does \ds \int_3^5 f(x)\, dx represent?

solution.p: The net change in height between 3 and 5 miles from the start of the trail.

example.statement: The current in a wire is defined to be the derivative of charge, i.e. I(t) = Q'(t). What does \ds \int_a^b I(t)\, dt represent?

solution.p: The net change in charge between t=a and t=b

example.statement: A particle moving along a line has acceleration given by a(t) = 2t+3. If v(0) = -4, find the particle's velocity and distance traveled in the first three seconds of motion.

solution.p: v(t) = t^2 + 3t-4 and the distance traveled is \dfrac{89}{6}.
